top_negative.sent: On April 28, 2022, the State of Arkansas filed a complaint in state court alleging violations of the Arkansas Deceptive Trade Practices Act, gross negligence and negligence, strict liability in tort, unjust enrichment and civil conspiracy related to the sale of products that may have been contaminated by virtue of rodent infestation and other unsanitary conditions at DC 202.

An amended consolidated complaint seeking class action status was filed October 17, 2022 alleging violations of the Mississippi, Arkansas, Louisiana, Tennessee, Alabama and Missouri consumer protection laws, breach of warranty, negligence, misrepresentation, deception and unjust enrichment related to the sale of products that may be contaminated by virtue of rodent infestation and other unsanitary conditions at DC 202.
The plaintiffs seek compensatory, punitive and exemplary damages, damages for loss of consortium, and attorneys’ fees and costs.

forward_snippets: We will vigorously defend ourselves in these matters.
Because of the investments in new products, we expect Dollar Tree’s gross margin to be lower in the first half of fiscal 2023 compared to the prior year.
We believe the addition of adult beverage to our assortment will drive traffic to our stores.

We anticipate that these investments will relate to four key areas of our business: our associates, our distribution center network and supply chain, our product pricing and value proposition, and our technology infrastructure.
Because of the investments in new products, we expect Dollar Tree’s gross margin to be lower in the first half of fiscal 2023 compared to the prior year.
